questions.question: Which is TRUE about the Roman Empire?

choices.answer: It was led by a pharaoh.
It stretched east to England and west to Iraq.
It was once the largest empire in the world.
It parted many different people and cultures from each other.

questions.question: Which is NOT correct about Pax Romana?

choices.answer: It brought peace and stability to the empire.
It made people grew more and more dissatisfied.
It did not benefit all of its people who lived in the empire equally.
It is the tight control of Romans that kept the people from fighting.

questions.question: Why did the Goths declare war against the Romans?

choices.answer: Because the Gothic tribes attacked their borders
Because some Romans fought against the Germanic tribe
Because some Gothic tribes fought against the Roman Empire
Because some Gothic tribes joined the empire and fought with the Romans

questions.question: Why did the Roman Empire begin to decline?

choices.answer: Because the Roman Empire has a weak defense
Because Barbarians stole the wealth of the Roman Empire
Because attackers gained control over important Roman provinces
Because the Roman emperor gave up the empire to the Barbarians

questions.question: If the Roman Empire gained control of Portugal, what would they do with the territory?

choices.answer: Sell Portugal to the Suevi.
Build a wall around Portugal.
Expand the empire into Portugal.
Declare Portugal as the capital of the empire.

questions.question: You have conquered land that has an iron ore reserve. How would you allocate this resource?

choices.answer: Build houses in that land.
Extract the iron by mining.
Use the land as a battlefield.
Grow crops and raise animals in that land.

questions.question: You have conquered land that has fertile soil. How would you allocate this resource?

choices.answer: Build houses in that land.
Extract the iron by mining.
Use the land as a battlefield.
Grow crops and raise animals in that land.

questions.question: What happened when the western part of the Roman Empire faced serious challenges?

choices.answer: The Roman Empire collapsed.
The Roman Empire was rebuilt.
The Roman Empire was unified.
The Roman Empire was divided.

questions.question: How did Justinian I use the legal system of the Byzantine Empire?

choices.answer: He used this to govern all the citizens of the empire.
He used this to negotiate peace with the rival empires.
He used this to regain control over territories the empire had lost.
He used this to protect his borders from attacks by neighboring tribes.

questions.question: What event damaged agriculture and trade during Justinian I's reign?

choices.answer: foreign wars
Golden Age of Byzantium
Justinian Code
Plague of Justinian

questions.question: Which is NOT true about the Plague of Justinian?

choices.answer: It weakened the Roman Empire.
It was the only crisis faced by Justinian I.
It was carried by rats onto ships from Egypt.
It caused up to 5,000 deaths a day from 541-542 CE.

questions.question: The Golden Age of Byzantium went through a 250-year period of the following EXCEPT:

choices.answer: Artistic Movement
Cultural
Literature
Philosophy

questions.question: Art and literature flourished during the reign of Basil I. Which movement is similar to this?

choices.answer: Golden Age of Islamic Art
Golden Age of Islamic Civilization
Golden Age of Islamic Culture
Golden Age of Islamic Philosophy

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a way of knowing the events that happened in the Roman Empire?

choices.answer: By visiting heritage museums
By reading the written records or books about it
By interviewing the emperors of the empire
By studying the artifacts and archeological sites

questions.question: Why is the heritage museum important to us?

choices.answer: Because it helps us learn necessary concepts and skills
Because it collects, preserves, interprets, and presents works of art
Because it provides environmental, aesthetic, & recreation benefits
Because it acquires, preserves, researches, interprets & exhibits artifacts

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Vikings as agricultural people?

choices.answer: They built ships with their skills.
They conquered vast areas of Europe.
They traded crops and cattle with other tribes.
They grew grains such as oats, barley, and corn.

questions.question: Viking society was made up of kings, jarls, chieftains, free farmers, and slaves. What does it tell us about their socie

choices.answer: Viking society was allowed to own properties.
Viking society was managed by different people.
Viking society was organized in a hierarchical way.
Viking society was controlled into smaller groups of people.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT correct about the Viking longhouse?

choices.answer: It was the focus of Viking family.
It has a hearth or a living room with a fireplace.
It was one of the Vikings’ major architectural innovations.
It was a long boat-shaped house made of metal and cement.

questions.question: Why did the Vikings raid cease?

choices.answer: Because Vikings changed the name of their tribe into Goth
Because Scandinavia has been conquered by the Byzantine Empire
Because the Vikings joined the Byzantine Empire and fought with them
Because Vikings managed to sail far from Scandinavia and settled there

questions.question: What is stereotyping?

choices.answer: It is the idea that men and women are not equal.
It is the belief that one’s race is inferior or superior to one another.
It is an over-generalized belief of a particular group or class of people.
It is the unjust or prejudicial treatment of different categories of people

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a stereotype of the Vikings?

choices.answer: Vikings wore helmets with horns.
Vikings kidnapped and killed villagers.
Vikings’ ship did not have a dragon head on it.
Vikings stole gold, silver and any valuables that they found.

questions.question: Which of the following is the source of the common stereotypes of Vikings?

choices.answer: Europeans told people to stereotype the Vikings.
Nonfiction books taught people to stereotype the Vikings.
Movies and video games lead people to stereotype the Vikings.
News on television and newspaper urges people to stereotype the Vikings.

questions.question: The following statements tell us the harmful effect of stereotyping EXCEPT one. Which is it?

choices.answer: It creates positive view about someone.
It can cause the victims to be driven by fear.
It can lead people to live lives driven by hate.
It is encouraging bullying behavior that children carry into adulthood.

questions.question: Which of the following is TRUE about the Republic of Venice?

choices.answer: Venice is the wealthiest city in the present day.
Venice uses small rivers and boats to move around.
Venice controlled much of Mediterranean and Arabian Seas.
Venice is a small city in Greece made up of less than twenty islands.

questions.question: Why was Venice able to grow wealthy and powerful?

choices.answer: Because it conquered rich countries
Because it has an oil and gas reservoir
Because it was the capital of the Byzantine Empire
Because of the trading relationship it established with Egypt

questions.question: Alexios I Komnenos asked for the help of the Venetians against the Normans. Why did Venice sign the treaty?

choices.answer: Because Venice received money as payment for their service
Because Byzantine Empire allowed Venice to free trade throughout the empire
Because Byzantine Empire supplied Venice with spices and other trading good
Because Venice just wanted to help the empire without asking any payment

questions.question: When did Venice’s wealth and power start to decline?

choices.answer: In the early 17th century
In the early 18th century
In the late 19th century
In the late 20th century

questions.question: What does it mean to make a promise?

choices.answer: It means not telling the truth.
It means giving a spoken or written account of something.
It means politely or formally asking someone to do something.
It means to tell someone that one will definitely do something one day

questions.question: Which of the following statements does NOT express a promise?

choices.answer: I swear I won't let you down.
I’m sorry I did not keep my words.
Believe me, I won't make you disappointed.
I assure you that I will return the book tomorrow morning.

questions.question: Why is it important to keep one’s promises?

choices.answer: Keeping promises means keeping faith in yourself.
When we keep our promises, we feel disappointed.
Keeping promises is important in breaking happy and healthy relationships.
When we keep our promises, others view us as immature, and unreliable.
